background: A pharmacy manufactures eye cream and foot cream using two machines with specific production capabilities and distilled water requirements. The goal is to minimize the total production time while meeting minimum cream production requirements.
constraints: At least MinEyeCream ml of eye cream must be produced
At least MinFootCream ml of foot cream must be produced
Time spent on Machine 1 is non-negative
Time spent on Machine 2 is non-negative
objective: Minimize the total time spent using machines 1 and 2
description: A pharmacy makes eye cream and foot cream using two different machines, machine 1 and machine 2. Machine 1 can make \param{EyeMachine1} ml of eye cream and \param{FootMachine1} ml of foot cream per hour. Machine 2 can make \param{EyeMachine2} ml of eye cream and \param{FootMachine2} ml of foot cream per hour. Furthermore, machine 1 requires \param{WaterMachine1} ml of distilled water per hour while machine 2 requires \param{WaterMachine2} ml of distilled water per hour. The pharmacy has available \param{TotalWater} ml of distilled water. If the pharmacy needs to make at least \param{MinEyeCream} ml of eye cream and \param{MinFootCream} ml of foot cream, how many hours should each machine be used to minimize the total time needed?

parameters.definition: Amount of eye cream produced by machine 1 per hour
Amount of foot cream produced by machine 1 per hour
Amount of eye cream produced by machine 2 per hour
Amount of foot cream produced by machine 2 per hour
Amount of distilled water required by machine 1 per hour
Amount of distilled water required by machine 2 per hour
Total amount of distilled water available
Minimum required amount of eye cream to be produced
Minimum required amount of foot cream to be produced
